TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Content extends System.Web.UI.Control implements class System.Web.UI.INamingContainer

Docs.summary: Holds text, markup, and server controls to render to a control in a master page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A control is a container for the content and controls of a content page. A control is used only with a master page that defines a corresponding control. A control is not added to the control hierarchy at runtime. Instead, the contents within the control are directly merged into the corresponding control. The control is associated with a using its property. Set the property to the value of the property of a control in a master page. When the URL of the content page is called, all text, markup, and server controls that are contained within the control are rendered to the on the master page, and the address bar of the browser will show the name of the content page. For more information about master pages and content pages, see [ASP.NET Master Pages](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4e53eedf-8304-4e7a-aed1-691a2623b28b). ## Declarative Syntax ```     Visible="True|False"          ``` ## Examples The following code example shows how to use the control to define the content for a master page. The first Web page is a master page and defines a content region using a control. [!code-xml[System.Web.UI.MasterPage_1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.UI.MasterPage_1/CS/MasterPageSample_1cs.master#1)] The following code example demonstrates how to use a content page for the preceding master page. The text, markup, and any server controls that are defined within the control template are rendered to the on the master page. ```csharp <%@ Page Language="C#" MasterPageFile="~/MasterPageSample_1cs.master" Title="Content Page"%> Hello, Master Pages! ``` ```vb <%@ Page Language="VB" MasterPageFile="~/MasterPageSample_1vb.master" Title="Content Page"%> Hello, Master Pages! ```

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content> control typically is created declaratively, not programmatically. For an example, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the control that is associated with the current content.
Docs.value: A string containing the ID of the associated with the current content. The default is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks All content that is encapsulated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content> control renders within the referenced <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentPlaceHolder> control in a master page. A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content> control is not added to the control hierarchy at runtime.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes. For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content.ContentPlaceHolderID%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentPlaceHolder> control in an ASP.NET Web page.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content> class.
```csharp <%@ Page Language="C#" MasterPageFile="~/MasterPageSample_1cs.master" Title="Content Page"%>
<asp:content runat="server" contentplaceholderid="ContentPlaceHolder1" >Hello, Master Pages!</asp:content> ```
```vb <%@ Page Language="VB" MasterPageFile="~/MasterPageSample_1vb.master" Title="Content Page"%>
<asp:content runat="server" contentplaceholderid="ContentPlaceHolder1" >Hello, Master Pages!</asp:content> ```

Docs.exception: An attempt was made to set the property at run time.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the control binds to a data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content.DataBinding> event is never invoked and does not appear in visual designers.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the control is released from memory.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content.Disposed> event is never invoked and does not appear in visual designers.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the control is initialized.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content.Init> event is never invoked and does not appear in visual designers.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the server control is loaded into the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content.Load> event is never invoked and does not appear in visual designers.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the server control is about to render to its containing control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content.PreRender> event is never invoked and does not appear in visual designers.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the server control is unloaded from memory.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Content.Unload> event is never invoked and does not appear in visual designers.
